Harrowstorm.name: Harrowstorm
Harrowstorm.flavor: You call up a churning cyclone from the nether planes. It surrounds your enemy, battering him with deafening claps of thunder and hurling him a short distance.
Harrowstorm.onHit: 2d10 + Constitution modifier thunder damage, and you slide the target 5 squares.
Harrowstorm.infernalPact: You slide the target a number of squares equal to 5 + your Intelligence modifier.

Hunger of Hadar.name: Hunger of Hadar
Hunger of Hadar.flavor: You create a zone of complete, impermeable darkness filled with flying, fluttering, fanged shadows. The shadows rend at the very life force of creatures caught within.
Hunger of Hadar.effect: The burst creates a zone of darkness until the end of your next turn, blocking line of sight. Creatures that enter or start their turns in the zone take 2d10 necrotic damage (a creature can take this damage only once per turn).
Hunger of Hadar.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn, and you make a secondary attack.

Shadow Form.name: Shadow Form
Shadow Form.flavor: You fly apart into a swarm of batlike shadows.
Shadow Form.effect: You assume a shadowy form until the end of the encounter or for 5 minutes. In this form you are insubstantial, gain fly 6, and can’t take standard actions. Reverting to your normal form is a minor action.

Wings of the Fiend.name: Wings of the Fiend
Wings of the Fiend.flavor: You sprout a large pair of leathery wings from your back.
Wings of the Fiend.effect: You grow wings and gain a fly speed equal to your speed until the end of the encounter or for 5 minutes.

Cloak of Shadow.name: Cloak of Shadow
Cloak of Shadow.flavor: You briefly become a flying shadow, swift and insubstantial.
Cloak of Shadow.effect: Fly a number of squares equal to your speed + 2. If you don’t land at the end of this move, you fall. Until the end of your next turn, you are insubstantial, and you cannot affect, attack, or use powers on creatures or objects.

Armor of Agathys.name: Armor of Agathys
Armor of Agathys.flavor: You surround yourself in a sheath of black ice from a dark and doleful realm. It protects you from attack and radiates fierce cold.
Armor of Agathys.effect: You gain temporary hit points equal to 10 + your Intelligence modifier. Until the end of the encounter, an enemy that starts its turn adjacent to you takes 1d6 + Constitution modifier cold damage.

Raven's Glamor.name: Raven's Glamor
Raven's Glamor.flavor: You teleport yourself away from imminent danger, but you leave an illusion of yourself behind, distracting and confusing your foes.
Raven's Glamor.effect: You become invisible until the end of your next turn and teleport 20 squares. You leave behind an illusory image of yourself that persists as long as you are invisible. This image stands in place, takes no actions, and uses your defenses if it is attacked. If the illusion is touched or takes any damage, it dissolves into a pile of dead leaves. If you make an attack, you become visible.
Raven's Glamor.sustainMove: The invisibility persists until the end of your next turn or until you attack, and you teleport up to 5 squares.

Shadow Veil.name: Shadow Veil
Shadow Veil.flavor: You garb yourself in a pall of murky darkness. While it lasts you are difficult to see or hear.
Shadow Veil.effect: You gain a +5 power bonus to Stealth checks until the end of your next turn.

Dark Transport.name: Dark Transport
Dark Transport.flavor: You forge a short-lived dimensional gate that slices through your opponent. If you wish, you can leap through the gate and take his place while banishing him to the spot you were just in.
Dark Transport.onHit: 4d10 + Charisma modifier damage, and you can swap places with the target.
Dark Transport.starPact: After swapping places with the target, you can teleport a number of squares equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Howl of Doom.name: Howl of Doom
Howl of Doom.flavor: You unleash a devastating shout that cracks stone and pulps flesh. Supernatural terror goes with your mighty blast, and your foes are driven back in fright.
Howl of Doom.onHit: 2d6 + Constitution modifier thunder damage, and you push the target 2 squares.
Howl of Doom.infernalPact: The distance of the push equals 1 + your Intelligence modifier.

Hurl Through Hell.name: Hurl Through Hell
Hurl Through Hell.flavor: You open a short-lived planar rift to the depths of the Nine Hells. It appears as a fiery crevice beneath your enemy’s feet, into which he falls screaming, and disappears. A few moments later, a flaming arch appears in the air over the spot where he was standing and disgorges a broken, mewling piece of charred meat.
Hurl Through Hell.onHit: 4d10 + Constitution modifier fire damage, and the target disappears into the Nine Hells until the end of your next turn. The target returns to the same space it left, or the nearest unoccupied space, and is prone and stunned (save ends).
Hurl Through Hell.sustainMinor: If you spend a minor action to sustain the power, the target’s return is delayed until the end of your next turn. You can sustain the power no more than three times.
Hurl Through Hell.onMiss: Half damage, and the target does not disappear.

Tartarean Tomb.name: Tartarean Tomb
Tartarean Tomb.flavor: You create a battering storm of rune-scribed black iron plates around your foe. As they whirl and strike, they quickly assemble into a coffinlike prison of iron and shadow.
Tartarean Tomb.onHit: 5d10 + Constitution modifier damage, and the target is entombed (save ends). An entombed target is immobilized and lacks line of sight and line of effect to any space other than its own. All creatures other than you cannot gain line of sight or line of effect to the target.
Tartarean Tomb.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).

Infuriating Elusiveness.name: Infuriating Elusiveness
Infuriating Elusiveness.flavor: You will yourself across the boundary between worlds, teleporting a short distance. When you appear from the Feywild, you are surrounded by a glamor of invisibility.
Infuriating Elusiveness.effect: You become invisible and then teleport 4 squares. The invisibility lasts until the start of your next turn.

Otherwind Stride.name: Otherwind Stride
Otherwind Stride.flavor: You call up an unseen maelstrom of fey power that lashes nearby creatures . . . and you step into the vortex and emerge somewhere a short distance away.
Otherwind Stride.onHit: 1d8 + Charisma modifier damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Otherwind Stride.feyPact: Add your Intelligence modifier to the distance of the teleportation.

Warlock's Leap.name: Warlock's Leap
Warlock's Leap.flavor: You leap through the mystic veil into the Feywild. An instant later, you return a short distance away and alight without traveling through the intervening air.
Warlock's Leap.effect: You teleport 6 squares. You do not need line of sight to the destination, but if you attempt to teleport to a space you can’t occupy, you don’t move.

Fiendish Resilience.name: Fiendish Resilience
Fiendish Resilience.flavor: You call upon your patron entities to protect you with their fell power. Your flesh is infused with mystic strength, lessening the effect of enemy blows.
Fiendish Resilience.effect: You gain temporary hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier.

Ethereal Stride.name: Ethereal Stride
Ethereal Stride.flavor: You shift your body out of phase with the world for an instant, teleporting a short distance. When you reappear, you are still somewhat out of phase and difficult to harm or hinder for a short time.
Ethereal Stride.effect: You can teleport 3 squares, and you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn.

Ambassador Imp.name: Ambassador Imp
Ambassador Imp.flavor: You conjure forth an implike presence from the netherworld and give it a message to deliver to a far-off creature.
Ambassador Imp.effect: You whisper a message into the air, and an implike presence appears next to the creature you wish to speak to and delivers your message. If the creature has a reply, the imp appears adjacent to you at the end of your next turn to utter it. If the creature has no reply or is not within range, the imp appears adjacent to you at the end of your next turn to tell you so. The imp then disappears.

Beguiling Tongue.name: Beguiling Tongue
Beguiling Tongue.flavor: You channel the grace and glibness of your fey patrons for a time. Your voice gains great power and eloquence.
Beguiling Tongue.effect: You gain a +5 power bonus to your next Bluff, Diplomacy, or Intimidate check during this encounter.

Fireswarm.name: Fireswarm
Fireswarm.flavor: Fiery scorpions crawl out of cracks in the ground and swarm your enemy, stinging madly and spreading out to engulf other nearby creatures.
Fireswarm.onHit: 4d10 + Constitution modifier fire and poison damage.
Fireswarm.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you can take a standard action once per round to make a Constitution vs. Fortitude attack against the target. On a hit, the target and each creature adjacent to it take 2d10 + Constitution modifier fire and poison damage. On a miss, you deal half damage, and the power ends.

Delusions of Loyalty.name: Delusions of Loyalty
Delusions of Loyalty.flavor: Your magic causes your enemy to perceive you as a comrade he must defend, even if he is now at odds with his former allies.
Delusions of Loyalty.onHit: 2d10 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, and the target is subjected to delusions (save ends). Until the effect ends, the target’s first action on each of its turns must be a standard action used to charge or make a basic attack against the last enemy of yours to attack you since your last turn. If no one attacked you since your last turn or if the target is unable to attack, the target loses its standard action.

Doom of Delban.name: Doom of Delban
Doom of Delban.flavor: A single slanting shaft of frigid starlight strikes your enemy from above and clings to him. Under its unbearable touch, flesh becomes white ice and steel shatters like glass, but you must pay a price to keep Delban’s deadly light focused on your foes.
Doom of Delban.sustainStandard: You can attack the same target or switch to a new target within range. Make an attack (as above) and increase the cold damage by 1d10 each time this power hits. Each time you sustain this power, you take 2d10 damage.

Summons of Khirad.name: Summons of Khirad
Summons of Khirad.flavor: A pale blue flame springs up from your brow as you invoke Khirad, a star of dire portent. Your enemy’s mind burns with Khirad’s flame, and you teleport him where you wish.
Summons of Khirad.onHit: 3d8 + Constitution modifier psychic damage, and you teleport the target to an unoccupied square within 3 squares of you.
Summons of Khirad.effect: Until the end of the encounter, once per round as a minor action, starting on your next turn, you can make a Constitution vs. Will attack against the target if it is within range but not necessarily within line of sight. On a hit, you teleport the target to an unoccupied square within 3 squares of you. On a miss, the effect ends.

Minions of Malbolge.name: Minions of Malbolge
Minions of Malbolge.flavor: You bring forth fire in the shape of small, infernal imps from Malbolge, sixth of the Nine Hells. They hover close around you and hurl themselves upon any enemy that dares to approach, searing with their fiery touch and driving foes away.
Minions of Malbolge.effect:
You conjure flames in the shape of diabolic imps that appear at your feet. You gain 25 temporary hit points.
Any enemy that enters a square adjacent to you takes 2d10 fire damage and is pushed 3 squares. This effect applies once per enemy per round. It ends when you end your turn with no temporary hit points.

Tendrils of Thuban.name: Tendrils of Thuban
Tendrils of Thuban.flavor: From the frozen emerald seas under the star Thuban, you call forth dozens of glimmering green tentacles. Reaching down from overhead, they seize your enemies, draining the heat from their bodies and holding them immobile.
Tendrils of Thuban.onHit: 3d10 + Constitution modifier cold damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).
Tendrils of Thuban.effect: The burst creates a zone of tendrils that lasts until the end of your next turn.
Tendrils of Thuban.sustainMinor: Make a Constitution vs. Fortitude attack against all targets within the zone. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 + Constitution modifier cold damage.

Dread Star.name: Dread Star
Dread Star.flavor: You create a fist-sized orb of painful blue-white radiance that whirls around your enemy, searing him. Fierce rays shoot from it like jabbing daggers of light, fencing him in where he stands.
Dread Star.onHit: 3d6 + Charisma modifier radiant damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Dread Star.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Dread Star.effect: The target takes a -2 penalty to Will defense (save ends).

Crown of Madness.name: Crown of Madness
Crown of Madness.flavor: You cause an illusory, twisted crown to appear around the target’s head. Under its psychic assault, your enemy loses the ability to distinguish friend from foe.
Crown of Madness.onHit: 2d10 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, and the target must use a free action to make a melee basic attack against one of its adjacent allies of your choice.
Crown of Madness.effect: The target is subjected to madness (save ends). Until the effect ends, you can use a minor action once per round, starting on your next turn, to cause the target to make a melee basic attack as a free action against one of its adjacent allies of your choice.

Flames of Phlegethos.name: Flames of Phlegethos
Flames of Phlegethos.flavor: Rivulets of clinging liquid fire appear and cascade over your target. Anything that is flammable ignites at once and burns long after the streams of magic fire fade away.
Flames of Phlegethos.effect: The target takes ongoing 5 fire damage (save ends).

Thirteen Baleful Stars.name: Thirteen Baleful Stars
Thirteen Baleful Stars.flavor: You create thirteen tiny crimson stars that dart and whirl around your enemy, blasting him with countless pinpricks of fire and lashing him with waves of supernatural terror.
Thirteen Baleful Stars.onHit: 5d10 + Constitution modifier fire and psychic damage, and the target is stunned until the end of your next turn.
Thirteen Baleful Stars.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Dark One’s Own Luck.name: Dark One’s Own Luck
Dark One’s Own Luck.flavor: Refusing the result that fate has decreed for you, you invoke stars of chaos and uncertainty and try to rewrite what has been written.
Dark One’s Own Luck.trigger: You make a roll you dislike
Dark One’s Own Luck.effect: Reroll the attack roll, skill check, ability check, or saving throw, using the higher of the two results.

Shielding Shades.name: Shielding Shades
Shielding Shades.flavor: You call up a swirling shield of darkness from some far domain, interposing it between yourself and dire peril.
Shielding Shades.trigger: You are hit and damaged by an attack
Shielding Shades.effect: The damage against you drops to 0.

Eldritch Blast.name: Eldritch Blast
Eldritch Blast.flavor: You fire a bolt of dark, crackling eldritch energy at your foe.
Eldritch Blast.onHit:
1d10 + Charisma modifier or Constitution modifier damage.
Increase damage to 2d10 + Charisma modifier or Constitution modifier at 21st level.
Eldritch Blast.special:
At 1st level, you determine whether you use Charisma or Constitution to attack with this power. Once you make that choice, you can’t change it later.
This power counts as a ranged basic attack. When a power allows you to make a ranged basic attack, you can use this power.

Dreadful Word.name: Dreadful Word
Dreadful Word.flavor: You whisper one word of an unthinkable cosmic secret to your foe. His mind reels in terror.
Dreadful Word.onHit: 2d8 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, and the target takes a -1 penalty to Will defense until the end of your next turn.
Dreadful Word.starPact: The penalty to Will defense is equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier.

Soul Flaying.name: Soul Flaying
Soul Flaying.flavor: You sear your enemy’s soul with a bolt of emerald energy, which weakens him greatly for a short time.
Soul Flaying.onHit: 2d8 + Constitution modifier necrotic damage, and the target is weakened until the end of your next turn.
Soul Flaying.infernalPact: The attack deals extra damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Entropic Ward.name: Entropic Ward
Entropic Ward.flavor: Fortune favors you; stars portending uncertainty lean in your favor and frown upon your foes.
Entropic Ward.effect: Until the end of your next turn, anyone who attacks you must roll two dice and take the lower result. Each time an attack misses due to this effect, you gain a cumulative +1 power bonus to your next attack roll.

Fiery Bolt.name: Fiery Bolt
Fiery Bolt.flavor: You call up a bolt of golden flame and hurl it at your foe. Anyone standing close to him is burned as well.
Fiery Bolt.onHit: 3d6 + Constitution modifier fire damage, and creatures adjacent to the target take 1d6 + Constitution modifier fire damage.
Fiery Bolt.infernalPact: Creatures adjacent to the target take extra fire damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Avernian Eruption.name: Avernian Eruption
Avernian Eruption.flavor: Acrid orange fumes hiss up from beneath the ground, and then suddenly ignite in a thundering detonation. Any creature in the area is burned by the searing flames.
Avernian Eruption.effect: The targets take ongoing 5 fire damage (save ends).

Hellfire Curse.name: Hellfire Curse
Hellfire Curse.flavor: You level your clenched fist toward your foe and unleash a terrific blast of black flames.
Hellfire Curse.infernalPact: You gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Sign of Ill Omen.name: Sign of Ill Omen
Sign of Ill Omen.flavor: You sketch a glowing rune in the air with your fingertip, invoking misfortune upon your enemy. Lines of eldritch power slash across his body as you draw your sign, and fate itself turns against him for a short time.
Sign of Ill Omen.onHit: 2d6 + Charisma modifier damage, and the target must roll twice for its next attack and use the lower of the two rolls.
Sign of Ill Omen.starPact: When the target rolls twice, it takes a penalty to both rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.flavor: You bestow on yourself the ability to cling to almost any surface and climb as easily as an insect.
Spider Climb.effect: On this move action, you move with a climb speed equal to your speed.

Bewitching Whispers.name: Bewitching Whispers
Bewitching Whispers.flavor: You whisper words of fey power, words that drive mortals to madness.
Bewitching Whispers.onHit: 2d8 + Charisma modifier psychic damage. Until the end of your next turn, the target treats all creatures as enemies for the purpose of making opportunity attacks and must make every opportunity attack possible.
Bewitching Whispers.feyPact: The target gains a power bonus to the opportunity attack rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Wrath of Acamar.name: Wrath of Acamar
Wrath of Acamar.flavor: You fire a ray of crackling black energy at your enemy. At its touch, he is instantly hurled headlong into the soul-draining depths of Acamar, a dark and distant star.
Wrath of Acamar.onHit: 4d10 + Charisma modifier necrotic damage, and the target disappears into a starry realm (save ends). Until this effect ends, the target cannot take actions, cannot be targeted, and takes 1d10 necrotic damage at the start of its turn. On a save, it returns to the space it was last in. If that space is occupied, the target returns to the nearest unoccupied space of its choice.
Wrath of Acamar.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Vampiric Embrace.name: Vampiric Embrace
Vampiric Embrace.flavor: A ribbon of twisting darkness streams from your hand to your target’s heart, feeding on his vital force as you grow stronger.
Vampiric Embrace.onHit: 2d8 + Constitution modifier necrotic damage, and you gain 5 temporary hit points.
Vampiric Embrace.infernalPact: Add your Intelligence modifier to the temporary hit points.

Curse of the Twin Princes.name: Curse of the Twin Princes
Curse of the Twin Princes.flavor: You begin to steal the very semblance of your target. Those around you and your foe can’t distinguish between the two of you any longer.
Curse of the Twin Princes.onHit: 4d10 + Charisma modifier psychic damage. Until the end of the encounter, every time you take damage, you make a Charisma vs. Will attack against the target; if the attack hits, you take half damage and the target takes the other half.
Curse of the Twin Princes.onMiss: Half damage. Until the end of your next turn, every time you take damage, you make a Charisma vs. Will attack against the target; if the attack hits, you take half damage and the target takes the other half.
Curse of the Twin Princes.effect: Until the end of the encounter, whenever you are adjacent to the target, the images of you both begin to flow together, such that anyone who hits one has a 50% chance of accidentally hitting the other instead.

Eldritch Rain.name: Eldritch Rain
Eldritch Rain.flavor: You fire purple rays of eldritch power at your foes.
Eldritch Rain.targets: One creature, or two creatures no more than 5 squares apart from each other
Eldritch Rain.attack: Charisma vs. Reflex, one attack per target
Eldritch Rain.feyPact: Gain a bonus to each attack’s damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Frigid Darkness.name: Frigid Darkness
Frigid Darkness.flavor: You create a freezing black shadow around your foe, a small taste of the icy darkness in the depths of the night sky. He is unable to see well enough to defend himself while the shadows cling to him.
Frigid Darkness.onHit: 2d8 + Constitution modifier cold damage, and the target grants combat advantage to you and your allies until the end of your next turn.
Frigid Darkness.starPact: The target takes a penalty to AC equal to your Intelligence modifier until the end of your next turn.

Shroud of Black Steel.name: Shroud of Black Steel
Shroud of Black Steel.flavor: Invoking the power of your dark patrons, you transform your skin into living steel, blackened and hard yet still supple enough to move. Your quickness suffers a bit, but you are much tougher and more resilient.
Shroud of Black Steel.effect: You change your skin into living steel. You gain a +2 power bonus to AC and Fortitude defense but take a -2 penalty to speed until the end of the encounter. You can end this effect as a minor action.

Thirsting Maw.name: Thirsting Maw
Thirsting Maw.flavor: With a flick of your wrist, you create a phantasmal eellike creature from your palm and hurl it at your foe. It latches itself to him and begins to drink his blood . . . and you grow stronger.
Thirsting Maw.onHit: 4d8 + Constitution modifier damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the amount of damage dealt.
Thirsting Maw.onMiss: Half damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the amount of damage dealt.
Thirsting Maw.effect: The target is subjected to the maw (save ends). Until the effect ends, starting on your next turn you can use a minor action once per round to deal 10 damage to the target, and you regain hit points equal to half that damage.

Thief of Five Fates.name: Thief of Five Fates
Thief of Five Fates.flavor: You bind your target’s fortunes to five ill-omened stars. Under their dire influence, all sorts of mischance and bad luck befall your enemy.
Thief of Five Fates.onHit: 2d6 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, and the target is subjected to the curse of five fates. Until the effect ends, the target takes a -4 penalty to attack rolls and saving throws, and gains vulnerable 5 to all damage. The effect ends after five instances of the target making an attack roll, making a saving throw, or taking damage.
Thief of Five Fates.onMiss: Half damage. In addition, the target is subjected to the curse of five fates, but it ends after two instances.

Eyebite.name: Eyebite
Eyebite.flavor: You glare at your enemy, and your eyes briefly gleam with brilliant colors. Your foe reels under your mental assault, and you vanish from his sight.
Eyebite.onHit:
1d6 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, and you are invisible to the target until the start of your next turn.
Level 21: 2d6 + Charisma modifier damage.

Dire Radiance.name: Dire Radiance
Dire Radiance.flavor: You cause a shaft of brilliant, cold starlight to lance down from above, bathing your foe in excruciating light. The nearer he moves toward you, the brighter and more deadly the light becomes.
Dire Radiance.onHit:
1d6 + Charisma modifier or Constitution modifier radiant damage. The first time the target moves closer to you on its next turn, it takes an extra 1d6 + Charisma modifier or Constitution modifier damage.
Level 21: 2d6 + Charisma modifier or Constitution modifier damage.

Hellish Rebuke.name: Hellish Rebuke
Hellish Rebuke.flavor: You point your finger, and your foe is scoured in hellish flames stoked by your own anger and pain. If you are injured, the flames burst into life one more time before they fade away.
Hellish Rebuke.onHit:
1d6 + Constitution modifier fire damage. The first time you take damage before the end of your next turn, the target takes 1d6 + Constitution modifier fire damage.
Level 21: 2d6 + Constitution modifier damage and extra damage.

Witchfire.name: Witchfire
Witchfire.flavor: From the mystic energy of the Feywild, you draw a brilliant white flame and set it in your enemy’s mind and body. Rivulets of argent fire stream up into the air from his eyes, mouth, and hands; agony disrupts his very thoughts.
Witchfire.onHit: 2d6 + Charisma modifier fire damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.
Witchfire.feyPact: The penalty to attack rolls is equal to 2 + your Intelligence modifier.

Diabolic Grasp.name: Diabolic Grasp
Diabolic Grasp.flavor: You crook your hand into the shape of a claw, and a great talon of sulfurous darkness forms around your enemy. It rakes fiercely at him and drags him a short distance before dissipating again.
Diabolic Grasp.target: One creature of size Large or smaller
Diabolic Grasp.onHit: 2d8 + Constitution modifier damage, and you slide the target 2 squares.
Diabolic Grasp.infernalPact: The distance of the slide equals 1 + your Intelligence modifier.

Mire the Mind.name: Mire the Mind
Mire the Mind.flavor: You assail your foe’s mind with unreal images until he can see nothing else.
Mire the Mind.onHit: 1d10 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, and you and all of your allies in range are invisible to the target until the end of your next turn.
Mire the Mind.feyPact: You gain a power bonus to Stealth checks equal to your Intelligence modifier until the end of the encounter.

Infernal Moon Curse.name: Infernal Moon Curse
Infernal Moon Curse.flavor: The shimmer of pale, ghostly silver envelops your foe and lifts him up into the air. Its sinister radiance seeps into his body, a strange and deadly poison.
Infernal Moon Curse.onHit: 2d8 + Constitution modifier poison damage, and the target is held immobilized 5 feet off the ground until the end of your next turn.
Infernal Moon Curse.infernalPact: You gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Coldfire Vortex.name: Coldfire Vortex
Coldfire Vortex.flavor: You create a spinning vortex of brilliant but frigid energy around your foe. Racing streamers of luminous coldfire lash all creatures nearby.
Coldfire Vortex.onHit: 3d8 + Constitution modifier damage (choose cold or radiant damage).
Coldfire Vortex.secondaryTarget: Each creature adjacent to the primary target
Coldfire Vortex.secondaryOnHit: 1d10 + Constitution modifier damage (choose cold or radiant damage).
Coldfire Vortex.starPact: You gain a bonus to damage rolls against the primary and secondary targets equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Thirsting Tendrils.name: Thirsting Tendrils
Thirsting Tendrils.flavor: You lower your hand, and rootlike tendrils shoot from your palm into the ground. An instant later they erupt from the earth beneath your enemy’s feet and bore into his flesh, replenishing you with his vital force.
Thirsting Tendrils.onHit: 3d8 + Charisma modifier damage, and you can spend a healing surge.
Thirsting Tendrils.feyPact: You regain additional hit points equal to twice your Intelligence modifier.

Warlock's Bargain.name: Warlock's Bargain
Warlock's Bargain.flavor: You forge a link between your enemy’s soul and your own, and then you surrender it to your fiendish patrons. It hurts you, but he suffers more.
Warlock's Bargain.onHit: You take damage equal to your level, and the target takes 3d10 + Constitution modifier damage plus extra damage equal to one-half your level.
Warlock's Bargain.infernalPact: Subtract your Intelligence modifier from the damage you take.

Strand of Fate.name: Strand of Fate
Strand of Fate.flavor: You call upon a snaking strand of distilled fate that lances toward your foe. If he can’t evade it, terrible misfortune ensues.
Strand of Fate.onHit: 1d8 + Charisma modifier damage, and the target gains vulnerability 10 to all attacks until the end of your next turn.
Strand of Fate.starPact: The vulnerability increases to 10 + your Intelligence modifier.

Banish to the Void.name: Banish to the Void
Banish to the Void.flavor: You hurl your foe screaming into the skies, and he disappears to some remote and terrible corner of the cosmos. When he returns, madness overwhelms him.
Banish to the Void.onHit: 3d8 + Constitution modifier damage. The target is removed from play until the start of its next turn. It then reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space (its choice) and makes a melee basic attack as a free action against the nearest creature. Until the end of your next turn, the target treats all creatures as enemies with respect to them provoking opportunity attacks, and the target must make every opportunity attack possible.

Curse of the Fey King.name: Curse of the Fey King
Curse of the Fey King.flavor: You invoke the power of a mighty fey spirit. A shimmering emerald coil of eldritch power disrupts your foe and steals from him the luck of his next few moments. It’s yours if you want it.
Curse of the Fey King.onHit: 4d10 + Charisma modifier damage. In addition, the first time the target rolls a d20 on its next turn, you can steal that result. The target rerolls, and you use the stolen result for your next d20 roll.
Curse of the Fey King.feyPact: You gain a bonus to the stolen result equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Thorns of Venom.name: Thorns of Venom
Thorns of Venom.flavor: Raising your hands, you call up from the ground thick vines studded with long, poisonous thorns that wrap around your foe. He is held fast and pierced by the deadly thorns.
Thorns of Venom.onHit: 3d8 + Charisma modifier poison damage, and the target is immobilized and takes a -2 penalty to AC and Reflex defense until the end of your next turn.
Thorns of Venom.feyPact: The penalty to AC and Reflex defense is equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier.

Spiteful Darts.name: Spiteful Darts
Spiteful Darts.flavor: You create scores of large, infernal darts and send them streaking at your enemies. Each dart that finds flesh pushes the creature it injures out of the place where it stands, moving it to another spot of your choosing.
Spiteful Darts.onHit: 4d8 + Constitution modifier damage, and you push the target 3 squares.
Spiteful Darts.infernalPact: Add your Intelligence modifier to the distance of the push.

Curse of the Dark Dream.name: Curse of the Dark Dream
Curse of the Dark Dream.flavor: You inflict a waking nightmare upon your enemy so that he can no longer tell what is real and what exists only in his mind. Under its influence he staggers about, trying to avoid falling from imaginary heights or stepping on unreal serpents.
Curse of the Dark Dream.onHit: 3d10 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, and you slide the target 3 squares.
Curse of the Dark Dream.effect: The target is subjected to the dark dream (save ends). Until this effect ends, you can slide the target 1 square as a minor action once per round, starting on your next turn.

Curse of the Bloody Fangs.name: Curse of the Bloody Fangs
Curse of the Bloody Fangs.flavor: You call up a pack of ferocious, phantasmal beasts from the darkest and most savage depths of the Feywild. Only their slavering fangs appear in this world, snapping and rending in a mad frenzy at the foe you have cursed.
Curse of the Bloody Fangs.effect: The target is subjected to bloody fangs (save ends). Until the effect ends, you can use a minor action once per round, starting on your next turn, to deal 1d10 damage to the target and each of your enemies adjacent to it.

Iron Spike of Dis.name: Iron Spike of Dis
Iron Spike of Dis.flavor: You call up a spear of red iron from the infernal regions and hurl it at your foe. Transfixing clothing, armor, flesh, or skin, it nails him to the spot where he stands.
Iron Spike of Dis.onHit: 3d10 + Constitution modifier damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).
Iron Spike of Dis.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed (save ends).

Curse of the Black Frost.name: Curse of the Black Frost
Curse of the Black Frost.flavor: You create a fence of sharp frost-needles around your foe. They slowly freeze him, and if he moves or touches them, they grow longer and sharper.
Curse of the Black Frost.effect: The first time the target moves on each of its turns it takes 1d8 cold damage (save ends). Until the effect ends, you can use a minor action once per round, starting on your next turn, to deal 10 cold damage to the target.

Curse of the Golden Mist.name: Curse of the Golden Mist
Curse of the Golden Mist.flavor: You lull your enemy into a waking dream. He sees himself in a realm of eldritch beauty, and perceives the real world as a ghostly shadow of itself.
Curse of the Golden Mist.onHit: 2d6 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, and the target doesn’t get a standard action on its turns (save ends).
Curse of the Golden Mist.onMiss: Half damage, and the target doesn’t get a standard action on its next turn.

Curse of the Dark Delirium.name: Curse of the Dark Delirium
Curse of the Dark Delirium.flavor: You trap your enemy's mind with bewildering fey power. He sees what you want him to see, he hears what you want him to hear. Like a sinister puppeteer, you can make him do almost anything you wish.
Curse of the Dark Delirium.onHit: 3d10 + Charisma modifier psychic damage. On the target’s next turn, you dictate its standard, move, and minor actions. It can’t use powers other than a basic attack, and it can’t take suicidal actions such as leaping off a cliff or attacking itself. Until the end of your next turn, the target cannot use immediate actions or opportunity actions.
Curse of the Dark Delirium.sustainStandard: You repeat the attack against the target as long as it is within range. On a miss, you can’t sustain this power.
Curse of the Dark Delirium.onMiss: Half damage. At the start of the target’s next turn, it must use a standard action to make a melee basic attack against its nearest ally.

Eye of the Warlock.name: Eye of the Warlock
Eye of the Warlock.flavor: You create upon your forehead a mystical third eye and link that eye’s perception to the senses of some other creature nearby.
Eye of the Warlock.effect: You see through the target’s eyes. The target is not aware that you are doing so. You have line of sight and line of effect from the target for your attacks. Your warlock powers can originate in the target’s square. Each time you use a power through this link, a mystical third eye briefly appears upon the target’s brow (save ends).

Cursebite.name: Cursebite
Cursebite.flavor: The shadowy aura of your curse grows teeth long enough to take a deep bite.
Cursebite.targets: Each creature in the burst under your curse
Cursebite.darkPact: The attack deals extra damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Deathboon.name: Deathboon
Deathboon.flavor: At your bidding, a Shadowfell patron extends a thread through the target’s lifeline. If the line snaps, some of the power returns to you. The rest goes to your patron.
Deathboon.onHit: 2d8 + Charisma modifier necrotic damage. If this attack drops the target to 0 hit points or fewer, you deal 1d8 extra damage with an attack you make before the end of your next turn.
Deathboon.darkPact: If this attack bloodies the target, you deal 1d8 extra damage with an attack you make before the end of your next turn.

Death's Commands.name: Death's Commands
Death's Commands.flavor: To a living foe, your dark speech foreshadows your enemy’s own death rattle. To the undead, your words sound like commands.
Death's Commands.onHit: 1d12 + Charisma modifier necrotic damage, and the target is dazed until the end of the target’s next turn. If the target is undead, it also cannot move closer to you on its next turn.
Death's Commands.darkPact: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls with this power against undead creatures.

Death's Fond Caress.name: Death's Fond Caress
Death's Fond Caress.flavor: This lazy tendril of corpse-yellow energy seems almost gentle as it caresses your foe, because all beings secretly yearn for death.
Death's Fond Caress.darkPact: This attack ignores resistance to necrotic damage.

Cursegrind.name: Cursegrind
Cursegrind.flavor: You whisper, and the bones of all those you have cursed wrench in time with each haunted syllable.
Cursegrind.targets: Each creature in the burst under your curse
Cursegrind.darkPact: The attack deals extra damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Unholy Glee.name: Unholy Glee
Unholy Glee.flavor: Your mystic gesture pushes your foe into inflicting murderous pain on itself.
Unholy Glee.onHit: 2d8 + Charisma modifier damage, and ongoing 10 poison damage (save ends). The target can end the ongoing poison damage by using a free action on its turn to deal 4d6 damage to itself.
Unholy Glee.darkPact: You can choose to attack the target’s Fortitude defense instead of its Will defense.

Dreadtheft.name: Dreadtheft
Dreadtheft.flavor: A purple ray from your hand rips into your enemies’ life forces.
Dreadtheft.attack: Charisma +2 vs. Reflex, one attack per target
Dreadtheft.onHit: 3d8 + Charisma modifier necrotic damage. If this attack drops a target to 0 hit points or fewer, the power is not expended.
Dreadtheft.darkPact: You gain one type of resistance possessed by the target until the end of your next turn.

Inevitable Undercut.name: Inevitable Undercut
Inevitable Undercut.flavor: All strength is doomed to crumble. Your spell’s shrieking assault demonstrates the point.
Inevitable Undercut.attack: Charisma vs. Fortitude. If the target has more hit points than you do when you attack, you gain a +2 power bonus to the attack roll.
Inevitable Undercut.darkPact: The power bonus to attack rolls against a target that has more hit points than you do is +4.

Your Glorious Sacrifice.name: Your Glorious Sacrifice
Your Glorious Sacrifice.flavor: Your true friends understand the sacrifices they need to make for your power.
Your Glorious Sacrifice.effect: Before the attack, you can deal damage to an ally adjacent to you equal to your Charisma modifier. If you do so, you gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll.
Your Glorious Sacrifice.onHit: 3d8 + Charisma modifier damage. If you dealt damage to an ally as part of this power, the target takes ongoing poison damage equal to your Charisma modifier (save ends).
Your Glorious Sacrifice.darkPact: The ongoing damage is instead equal to your Intelligence modifier + your Charisma modifier.
Your Glorious Sacrifice.onMiss: Half damage, and no ongoing damage.

One Final Sacrifice.name: One Final Sacrifice
One Final Sacrifice.flavor: You siphon life force from your allies to add pain and suffering to the attack you make against your common foe.
One Final Sacrifice.effect: Each ally within 5 squares of you takes 10 damage. For each ally damaged, the target takes 1d8 damage.
One Final Sacrifice.darkPact: For each ally damaged, the target instead takes 1d12 damage.

Twilight of the Soul.name: Twilight of the Soul
Twilight of the Soul.flavor: A gray aura withers your foe, quelling not only light but the will to live.
Twilight of the Soul.onHit: 2d6 + Charisma modifier necrotic damage, and ongoing 10 necrotic damage (save ends).
Twilight of the Soul.darkPact: The target has a –2 penalty to saving throws against the ongoing necrotic damage.

Dark Lady's Gift.name: Dark Lady's Gift
Dark Lady's Gift.flavor: With an evil word, you bless your foe with an ancient shadow’s kiss. Your foe looks on in horror as its nearby allies succumb as well.
Dark Lady's Gift.effect: The target takes ongoing 5 psychic damage (save ends). Whenever the target fails a saving throw against this ongoing damage, each enemy within 3 squares of the target takes 5 psychic damage.
Dark Lady's Gift.darkPact: Enemies within 5, instead of 3, squares take the psychic damage.

Your Delicious Weakness.name: Your Delicious Weakness
Your Delicious Weakness.flavor: The voices whisper of the cold between stars, between lives. You smile, and the spell that surges out against your enemy bites with the teeth of glaciers down into boiling blood.
Your Delicious Weakness.onHit: 2d6 + Charisma modifier psychic damage. If the target is vulnerable to any damage types, your attack instead deals damage of that type. If the target has more than one vulnerability, you choose which damage type to deal.
Your Delicious Weakness.darkPact: If the target takes damage of a type it is vulnerable to, it takes extra psychic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

All Must Sacrifice.name: All Must Sacrifice
All Must Sacrifice.flavor: The spell cuts with a jagged black ray—and if your allies donate their pain, it punches deeper.
All Must Sacrifice.onHit: 2d8 + Charisma modifier necrotic damage. You can choose to deal 1d8 damage to each ally within 3 squares of you to deal 1d8 extra damage with this power for each ally who takes damage.
All Must Sacrifice.darkPact: You instead deal 1d10 extra damage for each ally who takes damage.

Passionate Betrayal.name: Passionate Betrayal
Passionate Betrayal.flavor: Dark promises overwhelm your enemy’s sense of self. Those who were your foe’s friends are now threats.
Passionate Betrayal.onHit: The target is dominated (save ends). The target’s saving throw takes a –2 penalty for each unbloodied enemy (in other words, its allies) in the encounter, not counting minions. The target immediately makes a saving throw against being dominated if it is the target of an attack by you or your allies.
Passionate Betrayal.darkPact: All of the target’s basic attacks while dominated add your Intelligence modifier as a power bonus to attack rolls.

Your Delectable Pain.name: Your Delectable Pain
Your Delectable Pain.flavor: The weaknesses of your foe are obvious, singing forth from your enemy’s soul in tongues only you can hear.
Your Delectable Pain.onHit: 4d8 + Charisma modifier psychic damage. If the target is vulnerable to any  damage types, your attack instead deals damage of that type. If the target has more than one vulnerability, you choose which damage type to deal.
Your Delectable Pain.darkPact: If the target takes damage of a type it is vulnerable to, it takes extra psychic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Contagion.name: Contagion
Contagion.flavor: With a word, lesions and angry boils rise on your foe’s flesh. Its blood clouds with putrid juices and boils away through the air, snaking into the eyes and ears of your other enemies.
Contagion.onHit: Ongoing 10 poison damage (save ends). The first time the target fails a saving throw against this ongoing damage, each enemy within 2 squares of the target takes ongoing 5 poison damage (save ends).
Contagion.darkPact: On a failed saving throw, the ongoing damage instead spreads to each enemy within a number of squares equal to 2 + your Intelligence modifier.
Contagion.onMiss: Ongoing 5 poison damage (save ends). This ongoing damage does not spread.

Ring of Pain.name: Ring of Pain
Ring of Pain.flavor: You slam your fists together and a resonating circle of darkness engulfs your foe, crushing its will until the darkness leaps to a stronger target.
Ring of Pain.effect: The target takes ongoing 10 psychic damage (save ends). The first time the target fails a saving throw against this ongoing damage, you choose a second creature within 10 squares of you and deal ongoing 5 psychic damage to it (save ends)
Ring of Pain.darkPact: Add your Intelligence modifier to the ongoing damage.

Spider Scuttle.name: Spider Scuttle
Spider Scuttle.sourceRef: Forgotten Realms Player's Guide, Heroes of the Forgotten Kingdoms
Spider Scuttle.flavor: Shadowy spider legs sprout from your body, allowing you to scuttle across the ground and easily scale a nearby surface.
Spider Scuttle.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a climb speed equal to your speed, and you can move at that speed when you crawl.

Shadowslip.name: Shadowslip
Shadowslip.flavor: They wanted blood. You give them shadow.
Shadowslip.trigger: An enemy misses you with a melee or a ranged attack
Shadowslip.effect: Teleport a number of squares equal to your Charisma Modifier.

Darkest Mirror.name: Darkest Mirror
Darkest Mirror.flavor: A dark membrane snaps shut over your eyes. They reflect another world now, filled with shadows and spectral foes.
Darkest Mirror.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you can see invisible creatures as if they were not invisible. All other creatures, including your allies, are invisible to you. You can end this effect as a minor action.

Expedient Sacrifice.name: Expedient Sacrifice
Expedient Sacrifice.flavor: The sapped essence of your friend’s soul speeds you on like quicksilver in the darkness.
Expedient Sacrifice.effect: Until the end of the encounter, the target is slowed, and you gain a +4 bonus to speed.

Misty Step.name: Misty Step
Misty Step.flavor: You instantly transform into silver mist that streams a short distance and reforms, allowing you to flee or maneuver to set up a deadly attack.
keywords: Personal   Prerequisite: Fey Pact  Trigger: An enemy under your Warlock’s Curse is reduced to 0 hit points or fewer  Effect: You can immediately teleport 3 squares as a free action.
Misty Step.trigger: An enemy under your Warlock’s Curse is reduced to 0 hit points or fewer
Misty Step.effect: You can immediately teleport 3 squares as a free action.

Dark One's Blessing.name: Dark One's Blessing
Dark One's Blessing.flavor: You instantly gain vitality from a cursed enemy when that enemy falls.
keywords: Personal   Prerequisite: Infernal Pact  Trigger: An enemy under your Warlock’s Curse is reduced to 0 hit points or fewer  Effect: You immediately gain temporary hit points equal to your level.
Dark One's Blessing.trigger: An enemy under your Warlock’s Curse is reduced to 0 hit points or fewer
Dark One's Blessing.effect: You immediately gain temporary hit points equal to your level.

Fate of the Void.name: Fate of the Void
Fate of the Void.flavor: Your curse intermingles with the lost vitality of a cursed enemy to reveal a glimpse of the future to you.
keywords: Personal   Prerequisite: Star Pact  Trigger: An enemy under your Warlock’s Curse is reduced to 0 hit points or fewer  Effect: You gain a +1 bonus to any single d20 roll you make during your next turn (attack roll, saving throw, skill check, or ability check). If you don’t use this bonus by the end of your turn, it is lost.
Fate of the Void.trigger: An enemy under your Warlock’s Curse is reduced to 0 hit points or fewer
Fate of the Void.effect:
You gain a +1 bonus to any single d20 roll you make during your next turn (attack roll, saving throw, skill check, or ability check). If you don’t use this bonus by the end of your turn, it is lost.
This bonus is cumulative; if three cursed enemies drop to 0 hit points or fewer before your next turn, you gain a +3 bonus to a d20 roll during your turn.

Fey Switch.name: Fey Switch
Fey Switch.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Forgotten Kingdoms, Class Compendium
Fey Switch.flavor: You step through the veils of the Feywild to the place where an ally stands and return to the world in that spot. Your ally is instantly whisked back to the place you started from.
Fey Switch.effect: You and your ally trade spaces.

Spiteful Glamor.name: Spiteful Glamor
Spiteful Glamor.sourceRef: Forgotten Realms Player's Guide, Adventurer's Vault 2
Spiteful Glamor.flavor: The mere sight of you is anathema to your enemy.
Spiteful Glamor.onHit:
1d8 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, or 1d12 + Charisma modifier psychic damage to a target at maximum hit points.
Increase damage to 2d8 + Charisma modifier at 21st level, or 2d12 + Charisma modifier to a target at maximum hit points.

Flickering Venom.name: Flickering Venom
Flickering Venom.flavor: You deliver a dagger-shaped dose of magical energy that wounds and infects your unsuspecting foe.
Flickering Venom.onHit: 2d8 + Charisma modifier force damage, and if you have combat advantage against the target, you also deal poison damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Upsetting Onslaught.name: Upsetting Onslaught
Upsetting Onslaught.flavor: Your attack leabes your enemy reeling, unable to get its bearings without harming itself further.
Upsetting Onslaught.onHit: 1d8 + Charisma modifier damage, and the target is dazed until the end of its next turn. The target can negate being dazed by using a free actino to deal 2d8 damage to itself.
Upsetting Onslaught.darkPact: You can attack the target's Fortitude defense instead of its Will defense.

Forceful Assault.name: Forceful Assault
Forceful Assault.flavor: You wound your unwary foe with the sheer force of your nature, and on the heels of that assault you deliver a debilitating bolt of energy.
Forceful Assault.onHit: 3d8 + Charisma modifier force damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).
Forceful Assault.darkPact: The power’s range is 15 instead of 10.

Kimmeriel's Smile.name: Kimmeriel's Smile
Kimmeriel's Smile.flavor: His victims remember only this great assassin’s sardonic smile. This smile.
Kimmeriel's Smile.onHit: 3d8 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, and the target is dazed until it hits with an attack.
Kimmeriel's Smile.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is not dazed.
Kimmeriel's Smile.darkPact: The power’s range is 20 instead of 10.

Ruinous Resistance.name: Ruinous Resistance
Ruinous Resistance.flavor: You steel yourself against the threat of harm, but your ally feels strangely exposed.
Ruinous Resistance.targets: You and one ally in the burst
Ruinous Resistance.effect: Choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, psychic, radiant, or thunder. Until the end of the encounter, the targeted ally has vulnerable 5 to that damage type, and you gain resist 15 to it.

Explosive Contagion.name: Explosive Contagion
Explosive Contagion.flavor: Black and purple or greenish energy erupts from each of your foe’s orifices.
Explosive Contagion.onHit: 2d10 + Charisma modifier necrotic damage, and ongoing 10 poison damage (save ends). The first time the target fails a saving throw against this ongoing damage, each enemy within 5 squares of the target takes ongoing 5 poison damage (save ends).
Explosive Contagion.darkPact: Add your Intelligence modifier to the ongoing damage.
Explosive Contagion.onMiss: Half damage, and ongoing 5 poison damage (save ends). This ongoing damage does not spread.

Blades of Vanquished Armies.name: Blades of Vanquished Armies
Blades of Vanquished Armies.flavor: Foully animated darkness swirls around you, becoming a  bodyguard of shadowy blades crafted in ancient styles long vanished.
Blades of Vanquished Armies.onHit: 2d6 necrotic damage, and the target is weakened until the end of your next turn. In addition, until the end of your next turn, all creatures that hit you with a melee attack take necrotic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Blades of Vanquished Armies.darkPact: If you hit with this power, until the end of your next turn creatures you hit with a ranged attack take necrotic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Invisible Death.name: Invisible Death
Invisible Death.flavor: Lethal force applied from a distance spells doom for your adversary
Invisible Death.onHit: 4d8 force damage, and if the target grants combat advantage to you, the target also takes ongoing 10 force damage (save ends).
Invisible Death.darkPact: Add your Intelligence modifier to the ongoing damage.
Invisible Death.onMiss: Half damage, and no ongoing damage.

Ring of Torment.name: Ring of Torment
Ring of Torment.flavor: Your will compresses a tiny fragment of the hells into a ball of darkness, madness, and torment. Then you share.
Ring of Torment.onHit: 4d8 + Charisma modifier necrotic damage, and ongoing 10 psychic damage (save ends).
Ring of Torment.aftereffect: You choose a second creature within 20 squares of you and deal ongoing 5 psychic damage to it (save ends). The first time that creature fails a saving throw against this ongoing damage, you choose a third creature within 20 squares of you and deal ongoing 5 psychic damage to it (save ends).
Ring of Torment.onMiss: Half damage, and ongoing 10 poison damage (save ends). This ongoing damage does not spread.
Ring of Torment.darkPact: Add your Intelligence modifier to the ongoing damage.

Spread the Corrosion.name: Spread the Corrosion
Spread the Corrosion.flavor: You dart around the battlefield, leaving sizzling torment in your wake.
Spread the Corrosion.effect: Before the attack, you can shift 5 squares.
Spread the Corrosion.targets: One, two, or three creatures you were adjacent to as you shifted
Spread the Corrosion.attack: Charisma vs. Reflex, one attack per target
Spread the Corrosion.darkPact: You can use this power to attack a number of creatures equal to three or your Intelligence modifier, whichever is higher.

Darkworm Feast.name: Darkworm Feast
Darkworm Feast.flavor: You speak a single, forbidden word, summoning shadowy worms that burrow into your enemy’s body.
Darkworm Feast.onHit: 2d6 + Charisma modifier necrotic damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Darkworm Feast.darkPact: The target takes extra necrotic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier at the start of its next turn.

Chains of Levistus.name: Chains of Levistus
Chains of Levistus.flavor: Spectral chains of ice leap from your hands and lash around your enemy. They pulse with cold each time your enemy moves.
Chains of Levistus.onHit: 2d6 + Constitution modifier cold damage. If the target moves before the end of your next turn, it takes 2d6 extra cold damage.
Chains of Levistus.infernalPact: If the target moves before the end of your next turn, you also gain a +2 power bonus to your next attack roll against the target before the end of your next turn.

Fortune's Reversal.name: Fortune's Reversal
Fortune's Reversal.flavor: With a single word of power, you reverse a creature’s luck, turning fortune and happiness into misfortune and sorrow.
Fortune's Reversal.trigger: An enemy within 10 squares of you scores a critical hit or saves
Fortune's Reversal.onHit: 1d8 + Charisma modifier psychic damage. The target takes a -2 penalty to saving throws and ongoing 5 psychic damage (save ends both). The target cannot save against this power until it takes the ongoing psychic damage at least once.
Fortune's Reversal.darkPact: The target takes a -3 penalty to saving throws instead of -2.
Fortune's Reversal.feyPact: The target also takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls while affected by the ongoing psychic damage.
Fortune's Reversal.onMiss: The target takes ongoing 5 psychic damage (save ends). The target cannot save against this power until it takes the ongoing psychic damage at least once.

Tyranny of Flame.name: Tyranny of Flame
Tyranny of Flame.flavor: Burned by the fires of the Nine Hells, your enemy grovels, begging for mercy.
Tyranny of Flame.onHit: 3d6 + Constitution modifier fire damage, and the target can’t stand up from prone (save ends).
Tyranny of Flame.infernalPact: The target also takes a -2 penalty to saving throws against this power.

Devil's Trade.name: Devil's Trade
Devil's Trade.flavor: You call on infernal powers to trade a sliver of your soul for temporary relief.
Devil's Trade.effect: You gain vulnerable 5 to all damage until the end of your next turn, and you automatically succeed on one saving throw you make at the end of this turn.

Cloud of Flies.name: Cloud of Flies
Cloud of Flies.flavor: You breathe out a cloud of acidic black flies that streak across the battlefield, swarming your foe and attempting to enter its body.
Cloud of Flies.onHit: 2d6 + Constitution modifier acid damage, and the target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.
Cloud of Flies.infernalPactOrVestigePact: On a miss, the target grants combat advantage to you until the end of your next turn.

Fortune Binding.name: Fortune Binding
Fortune Binding.flavor: You create ethereal black ropes that bind you to your enemy. As the ropes twist, your luck improves and your enemy’s falters.
Fortune Binding.onHit: 2d8 + Constitution modifier psychic damage. You end one effect on you that a save can end, and the target gains that effect until the end of your next turn.
Fortune Binding.vestigePact: The attack deals extra damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Shared Agony.name: Shared Agony
Shared Agony.flavor: Sometimes pain is the price of victory. To wrack your opponent’s mind, you might have to give up a fragment of your own sanity.
Shared Agony.onMiss: You can take 10 psychic damage to reroll the attack roll.
Shared Agony.darkPact: If you reroll the attack roll and hit, reduce the psychic damage you take by your Intelligence modifier.

Tyrannical Threat.name: Tyrannical Threat
Tyrannical Threat.flavor: You speak, and each syllable is a deadly insinuation; each utterance a dangerous threat; each sentence, a dire curse.
Tyrannical Threat.onHit: 1d10 + Constitution modifier psychic damage, and you place your Warlock’s Curse on the target.
Tyrannical Threat.infernalPact: You place your Warlock’s Curse on the target.
Tyrannical Threat.effect: Until the end of the encounter, whenever a creature cursed by you attacks you, it takes psychic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Spider Queen's Caress.name: Spider Queen's Caress
Spider Queen's Caress.flavor: You whisper to those who dwell in the darkness of your undying love and loyalty, and in return you gain the gift of stealth.
Spider Queen's Caress.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +2 power bonus to saving throws and Stealth checks.
Spider Queen's Caress.darkPact: Your Shadow Walk grants concealment to you after you move 2 squares instead of 3.

Mercurial Form.name: Mercurial Form
Mercurial Form.flavor: Your form flows and shimmers, allowing you to slip through cracks, escape an enemy’s claws, and evade even the most persistent  hunter.
Mercurial Form.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you cannot be marked, you are considered Tiny for the purpose of squeezing, and you can automatically succeed at escaping from a grab as a free action.

Life Siphon.name: Life Siphon
Life Siphon.flavor: It’s not pretty, it’s not kind, but sometimes you need to draw power from an ally’s pain.
Life Siphon.trigger: An ally within 10 squares of you takes damage
Life Siphon.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to one attack roll before the end of your next turn.
Life Siphon.darkPact: You regain hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.
Life Siphon.infernalPact: You gain temporary hit points equal to twice your Constitution modifier.

All the Sand, All the Stars.name: All the Sand, All the Stars
All the Sand, All the Stars.flavor: You make your foe see all the grains of sand in the desert and all the stars in the heavens, and it reels in shock, unable to grasp infinity.
All the Sand, All the Stars.onHit: 2d6 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.
All the Sand, All the Stars.starPact: The attack deals extra psychic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Mordant Rains of Dis.name: Mordant Rains of Dis
Mordant Rains of Dis.flavor: You open a portal to Dis above your foe’s head, releasing caustic rain upon him.
Mordant Rains of Dis.onHit: 1d6 + Constitution modifier acid damage, and the target is blinded until the end of your next turn.
Mordant Rains of Dis.infernalPact: Each enemy adjacent to the target takes acid damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Nypacian Serpents.name: Nypacian Serpents
Nypacian Serpents.flavor: You create semblances of the serpents of the Nypacian Outlands to attack an enemy.
Nypacian Serpents.onHit: 2d8 + Charisma modifier damage. The first time the target takes damage before the end of your next turn, it takes extra poison damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Nypacian Serpents.feyPact: The poison damage equals twice your Intelligence modifier.

Shadow Strangler.name: Shadow Strangler
Shadow Strangler.flavor: A wraithlike creature appears behind your enemy and attempts to strangle it. With each of your foe’s attacks, the specter’s grip tightens.
Shadow Strangler.onHit: 2d8 + Charisma modifier damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.
Shadow Strangler.darkPact: Until the end of your next turn, whenever the target makes an attack roll, it takes damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Feast of Souls.name: Feast of Souls
Feast of Souls.flavor: Souls trapped in the Nine Hells are hungry for life. Opening a temporary rift, you give them a taste of your foes’ vitality.
Feast of Souls.onHit: 1d8 + Constitution modifier psychic damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).
Feast of Souls.effect: The burst creates a zone of hungry spirits that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is difficult terrain. Each creature that enters the zone or starts its turn there takes 1d8 + your Constitution modifier cold damage (a creature can take this damage only once per turn). As a move action, you can move the zone 2 squares.

Storm Countess's Kiss.name: Storm Countess's Kiss
Storm Countess's Kiss.flavor: You sarcastically blow a kiss at your enemy, creating a swirling gale that lifts your foe off the ground and then tosses it aside.
Storm Countess's Kiss.onHit: Charisma modifier cold damage, and the target is held restrained 10 feet (w2 squares) off the ground (save ends).
Storm Countess's Kiss.feyPact: The target is held restrained off the ground a number of feet equal to 10 + five times your Intelligence modifier.
Storm Countess's Kiss.aftereffect: The target falls, and you slide it 2 squares.
Storm Countess's Kiss.onMiss: You push the target 2 squares, and you knock it prone.

Horrifying Hatching.name: Horrifying Hatching
Horrifying Hatching.flavor: Spider eggs hatch inside your enemy’s flesh, unleashing a deadly poison and causing the creature to thrash in panic.
Horrifying Hatching.effect: The target takes ongoing 10 poison damage (save ends). Whenever the target takes this ongoing damage, you can slide the target 1 square.
Horrifying Hatching.darkPact: As a minor action, you can end the ongoing poison damage to deal 2d10 + your Intelligence modifier poison damage to the target.
Horrifying Hatching.feyPact: As a minor action, you can end the ongoing poison damage to slide the target 3 squares.

Destiny Inversion.name: Destiny Inversion
Destiny Inversion.flavor: You untangle the threads of fate, rearranging them to suit your whims.
Destiny Inversion.effect: You take no damage from the triggering attack. Instead, you take ongoing damage equal to half the triggering attack’s damage (save ends). The ongoing damage has the same damage type as the triggering attack.

Curse of Nessus.name: Curse of Nessus
Curse of Nessus.flavor: You transform your bad luck into your enemy’s misfortune.
Curse of Nessus.trigger: You miss an enemy with an attack
Curse of Nessus.effect: The target takes a -5 penalty to saving throws until the end of your next turn.

Bond of Brotherhood.name: Bond of Brotherhood
Bond of Brotherhood.flavor: An ancient enclave of eladrin shared in each other’s triumphs and pain; you borrow their magic to benefit from your ally’s healing.
Bond of Brotherhood.trigger: An ally within 10 squares of you spends a healing surge
Bond of Brotherhood.effect: You regain hit points equal to the amount the triggering ally regains.

Clarion Call.name: Clarion Call
Clarion Call.flavor: You invoke Yuri the Hunter, and the sound of his bellowing horn blasts your enemies into submission while inspiring you.
Clarion Call.onHit: 3d4 + Constitution modifier thunder damage, and the target is deafened until the end of your next turn.
Clarion Call.vestigePact: You gain 3 temporary hit points for each target you hit. Temporary hit points gained in this way are cumulative.

Hero's Arrow.name: Hero's Arrow
Hero's Arrow.flavor: You conjure a magic arrow and send it speeding toward an enemy. A hero’s arrow that hits its mark both hurts a foe and aids an ally.
Hero's Arrow.onHit: 2d8 + Constitution modifier damage. One ally adjacent to the target regains hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Hero's Arrow.vestigePact: Each ally adjacent to the target regains hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Dark Reach of Xevut.name: Dark Reach of Xevut
Dark Reach of Xevut.flavor: You call on Xevut, He Who Hungers, and send a dark maelstrom at one enemy, which transfers that creature’s affliction to a nearby foe.
Dark Reach of Xevut.trigger: An enemy within 10 squares of you saves against an effect
Dark Reach of Xevut.onHit: 2d8 + Charisma modifier psychic damage. One enemy within 3 squares of the target gains the effect that the target saved against.
Dark Reach of Xevut.starPact: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a bonus to saving throws equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Korred's Tune.name: Korred's Tune
Korred's Tune.flavor: The songs of the korred inspire a dance that can destroy one’s mind if ignored.
Korred's Tune.onHit: 3d6 + Charisma modifier damage. If the target does not move at least 3 squares during its next turn, it takes 1d6 psychic damage.
Korred's Tune.feyPact: If the target does not move at least 6 squares during its next turn, it takes 1d6 psychic damage.

Caution of Dispater.name: Caution of Dispater
Caution of Dispater.flavor: Dispater remains in control of his part of Hell through cunning and by beating rivals into submission. You borrow a page from his book.
Caution of Dispater.effect: The target takes 1d8 + your Constitution modifier psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the target is attacked or until it starts its turn without line of sight to you.
Caution of Dispater.infernalPact: The power’s effect does not end when you attack the target.

Plague of Frogs.name: Plague of Frogs
Plague of Frogs.flavor: You summon hundreds of carnivorous frogs that bite and harry creatures around them.
Plague of Frogs.effect: The burst creates a zone of hopping carnivorous frogs that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is difficult terrain. Each creature that enters the zone or starts its turn there takes 2d8 + your Charisma modifier damage (a creature can take this damage only once per turn). As a move action, you can move the zone 3 squares.
Plague of Frogs.sustainMinor: The zone persists, and you can move it 1 square.

Amaan's Continuance.name: Amaan's Continuance
Amaan's Continuance.flavor: Invoking the remnant of a dead god, you borrow its lingering power to act when you would normally lie on the ground, bleeding.
Amaan's Continuance.trigger: An attack reduces you to 0 hit points or fewer and doesn’t kill you
Amaan's Continuance.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you do not become unconscious from having 0 hit points or fewer.

Painful Transference.name: Painful Transference
Painful Transference.flavor: You transform your debilitation into an ally’s pain.
Painful Transference.effect: You end an effect on you that a save can end. Each ally within 5 squares of you takes damage equal to your Charisma modifier. If no ally is within 5 squares of you, you take damage equal to twice your Charisma modifier. This damage cannot be reduced or negated.

Warp Space.name: Warp Space
Warp Space.flavor: Using incomprehensible logic from beyond the stars, you rearrange the battlefield.
Warp Space.target: You and two allies in the burst
Warp Space.effect: Each target teleports to a space within the burst.

Hero's Defense.name: Hero's Defense
Hero's Defense.flavor: Your hasty spell draws on your greatest strength to cover your weaknesses.
Hero's Defense.trigger: An enemy makes an attack roll against you
Hero's Defense.effect: You gain a +4 bonus to your highest defense for this attack only, and the triggering enemy’s attack targets that defense. If the attack hits, it deals half damage to you.

Claws of the Magpie.name: Claws of the Magpie
Claws of the Magpie.flavor: A flock of spectral black and white birds flies through your enemy, tearing out pieces of the creature’s essence and power.
Claws of the Magpie.effect: Until the end of the target’s next turn, it can use only basic attacks or other at-will powers. Also, the target’s auras end and cannot be reactivated until the end of your next turn.
Claws of the Magpie.feyPact: You gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Maelstrom of Despair.name: Maelstrom of Despair
Maelstrom of Despair.flavor: You trap your foe in a crushing vortex of despair, wracking its mind with each passing moment of affliction.
Maelstrom of Despair.onHit: 3d10 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, and ongoing 5 psychic damage (save ends).
Maelstrom of Despair.effect: Until the end of your next turn, the target takes psychic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier whenever it rolls a saving throw.
Maelstrom of Despair.darkPact: The psychic damage the target takes whenever it rolls a saving throw equals twice your Intelligence modifier.
Maelstrom of Despair.feyPact: Whenever you sustain the effect, you gain a +2 bonus to saving throws until the end of your next turn.

Force of Nature.name: Force of Nature
Force of Nature.flavor: Your magic creates a primordial force that hurls your foe through the air.
Force of Nature.onHit: 6d10 + Charisma modifier damage, and you knock the target prone and push it a number of squares equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Force of Nature.onMiss: Half damage, and you push the target 1 square.

Ascension of the Elder.name: Ascension of the Elder
Ascension of the Elder.flavor: You use a planar pathway known by ancient vestiges to transport yourself to the safety of the sky, where you can remain for a time.
Ascension of the Elder.effect: You teleport 100 feet (20 squares) to a space directly above you. Until the end of your next turn, you gain a speed of fly 8.
Ascension of the Elder.sustainMove: The effect persists. When you fail to sustain the effect, you float to the ground without taking damage.

Walk of the Kantakaran.name: Walk of the Kantakaran
Walk of the Kantakaran.flavor: Your spell of peace borrows a lesson from the vestige of the Kantakaran monks, an order of mystics that espoused neutrality.
Walk of the Kantakaran.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you cannot use an attack power or be attacked.

Glow of Ulban.name: Glow of Ulban
Glow of Ulban.flavor: You call upon Ulban, whose blue-white light pierces the mind and interrupts the instinct for self-preservation in those caught in its otherworldly glow.
Glow of Ulban.starPact: If this attack hits, the target takes a –2 penalty to the next saving throw it makes before the end of the encounter.

Prophecy of Zhudun.name: Prophecy of Zhudun
Prophecy of Zhudun.flavor: You whisper snatches of prophecy glimpsed in the blank face of dead Zhudun. A vision flashes into your foe’s mind that is so horrifying that it loses track of its surroundings.
Prophecy of Zhudun.onHit: 2d8 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, and the target is dazed (save ends). The target treats all its enemies as if they are concealed until it saves from its dazed condition.

Crown of Stars.name: Crown of Stars
Crown of Stars.flavor: Flaring points of star-bright light encircle your head. With each gesture, a painful point of blue-white light leaps away in a halo of choking smoke toward one foe.
Crown of Stars.onHit: 2d12 + Charisma modifier radiant damage. If target is bloodied, it is blinded until the end of your next turn.
Crown of Stars.sustainMinor: Make a Charisma vs. Will attack against any target in range. On a hit, deal radiant damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

Fevered Certainty of Caiphon.name: Fevered Certainty of Caiphon
Fevered Certainty of Caiphon.flavor: You send your thoughts to Caiphon, the Dream Whisperer, whose direction lies beyond the farthest void and is normally unknowable. Flush with the eldritch vision, a mad certainty floods your body and mind.
Fevered Certainty of Caiphon.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +5 power bonus to all skill checks, but you take a –2 penalty to your Will defense.

Hands of Ihbar.name: Hands of Ihbar
Hands of Ihbar.flavor: Inky black, frigid tendrils emerge as if from your foe’s own body. The tendrils curl and wind around their parent so tightly that blood flow and movements are hampered.
Hands of Ihbar.onHit: 2d12 + Charisma modifier cold damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Hands of Ihbar.starPact: If the target has cold resistance, it is reduced by a number of points equal to your level (save ends).

Fury of Gibbeth.name: Fury of Gibbeth
Fury of Gibbeth.flavor: You revive the memory of ancient Gibbeth the Endless, slain before the primordials’ forge fires burned. Though formless, even the imperfect recollection of Gibbeth strikes out with all-too-real limbs of hate before you hastily forget it.
Fury of Gibbeth.onHit: 3d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target must succeed on an Acrobatics check that has a DC equal to 10 + your Charisma modifier + one-half your level or fall prone. At the start of its turn, the target must succeed on another Acrobatics check (DC as above) or fall prone again (save ends).
Fury of Gibbeth.onMiss: Half damage, and the target must make an Acrobatics check or fall prone.

Red Leeches of Nihal.name: Red Leeches of Nihal
Red Leeches of Nihal.flavor: Wriggling scarlet worms writhe suddenly across your foe’s body before dissolving just as quickly into odious vapor. When their rank odor stings your nostrils, stolen energy shudders through you.
Red Leeches of Nihal.trigger: One target in range spends an action point or a healing surge.
Red Leeches of Nihal.effect: You gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your second wind value.

Rending Fear of Khirad.name: Rending Fear of Khirad
Rending Fear of Khirad.flavor: A pale blue flame springs up from your brow as you incant the apocalypses over which Khirad has burned, thus hoping to frighten your foe into an admission.
Rending Fear of Khirad.effect: You demand that the target answer one question. If you share a language, your helpless target provides the answer to the best of its knowledge, without distortion. Each round, ask a new question if your target remains helpless, up to a number of questions equal to 1 + your Charisma modifier.

Far Realm Phantasm.name: Far Realm Phantasm
Far Realm Phantasm.flavor: You give brief life to the image of the creature you periodically see in visions hungrily whispering your name. Though your breath comes quicker, your target is caught unprepared for the mind-wrenching vision.
Far Realm Phantasm.onHit: 1d6 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, and the target spends its next standard action making a basic attack against the empty air.
Far Realm Phantasm.starPact: The target takes a –2 penalty to its Will until the end of your next turn.

Influence of Acamar.name: Influence of Acamar
Influence of Acamar.flavor: Crackling black energy shrouds your body as you briefly take on the least aspect of Acamar, a dark and distant star. Your closest foe is struck by a stray bolt and is pulled toward you.
Influence of Acamar.onHit: 3d8 + Charisma modifier necrotic damage, and you pull the target a number of squares equal to your Charisma modifier.
Influence of Acamar.starPact: This spell’s range is 20 instead of 10.

Brood of Hadar.name: Brood of Hadar
Brood of Hadar.flavor: You call upon Hadar the Ebon Hunger. Your foe screams, clutches its head, and falls. Flying, fluttering, fanged shadows pour from your foe’s open eyes, mouth, and ears, and descend upon one of your foe’s allies.
Brood of Hadar.onHit: 3d10 + Constitution modifier necrotic damage. If this damage is enough to reduce the target to 0 hit points, make a secondary attack.
Brood of Hadar.secondaryTarget: One enemy within 3 squares of the primary target.
Brood of Hadar.secondaryOnMiss: Half damage, and no secondary attack even if the target is reduced to 0 hit points.

Troublesome Aid of Caiphon.name: Troublesome Aid of Caiphon
Troublesome Aid of Caiphon.flavor: When an ally grants you the grace of renewed health, you leverage your knowledge of Caiphon’s healing lore to gain even greater advantage than was offered—but at what price?
Troublesome Aid of Caiphon.trigger: One ally in range grants you the use of a healing surge.
Troublesome Aid of Caiphon.effect: In addition to the normal number of hit points you regain, you regain a number of hit points equal to your healing surge value. However, until the end of the encounter, you die after failing your second, rather than third, death saving throw.

Blaze of Ulban.name: Blaze of Ulban
Blaze of Ulban.flavor: You channel the blue-white fire of Ulban, whose burning glory captivates mortal minds even as it consumes them.
Blaze of Ulban.onHit: 2d8 + Charisma modifier radiant damage, and slide one enemy within 5 squares of the target 2 squares.
Blaze of Ulban.starPact: If this attack hits, the target takes a –2 penalty to its next saving throw.

Visage of Zhudun.name: Visage of Zhudun
Visage of Zhudun.flavor: You manifest an aspect of the blank face of dead Zhudan, creating a zone of horror that hammers at the sanity of those caught within it.
Visage of Zhudun.effect: The burst creates a zone containing the semblance of a monstrous face, blocking line of sight. The zone lasts until the end of your next turn. Creatures that enter the zone or start their turns there take 3d10 psychic damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.
Visage of Zhudun.sustainMinor: When you sustain the power, you make a secondary attack.
Visage of Zhudun.secondaryOnHit: 1d10 + Charisma modifier psychic damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Far Realm Glimpse.name: Far Realm Glimpse
Far Realm Glimpse.flavor: You call up a vision of a space inhabited by vast entities whose vile, miles-long limbs churn an amoebic sea to bloody froth. Your foe screams and scrambles to get away.
Far Realm Glimpse.onHit: 3d8 + Charisma modifier psychic damage and the target is dazed (save ends). A target that does not move its full speed away from you on its next turn takes 2d8 + Charisma modifier damage and is dazed (save ends).

Caiphon's Disquieting Liberty.name: Caiphon's Disquieting Liberty
